Topic.Title: Operation Rollback to Windows 7.X

Message.Msg: I personally am very satisfied with Windows 7. I make my living on my computer; so I don't need a operating system that looks like it's for a tablet or smartphone. My son is a gamer on the PC and he installed it. He likes it but doesn't do any work on the computer; so for him it's good. However, he has had many errors on his lapstop which a very high-tech gaming computer. I won't be buying Windows 8. Who needs it?

Message.Title: windows 8 compiler...intel compiler C++ could, but right now doesn't support w8compiler c++
Message.Msg: windows 8 apps are w8compiler C++. windows 7 uses the legacy intel compiler c++. new capabilities will push enterprises to use windows 8 apps, including ability to publish once for all mobile platforms without sending them to india/bangladesh for specific sizing...would allow cloud app mashups to provide real crazy service...or so i've heard.

Message.Title: David Petraeus supports Obama administration over Benghazi
Message.Msg: David Petraeus supports Obama administration over Benghazi By Peter Foster, Washington 6:46PM GMT 16 Nov 2012 The disgraced former CIA director David Petraeus waded into the political row over the Benghazi attacks on Friday, supporting White House claims that it did not knowingly mislead the public over who was responsible. The general was adamant there was no politicisation of the process, no White House interference or political agenda," Mr Schiff said after the 90 minute testimony, "He completely debunked that idea."

Message.Title: Enterprise Interest In W8 Only Half That Of W7 In '09
Message.Msg: ComputerWorld reports that enterprise interest in W8 falls far behind that of W7 at its launch. Reasons give include migration fatigue, limited appeal of apps in Microsoft Store, confusion about differences between Windows 8 & RT and the vastly different user interface.

Topic.Title: Enterprise Interest In W8 Only Half That Of W7 In '09

Message.Title: Petraeus: Rice relied on "unclassified talking points
Message.Msg: Emerging from a Senate hearing with Petraeus, Democratic Sen. Kent Conrad of North Dakota said that what he heard from the former CIA director indicates that Rice relied on "unclassified talking points that the entire intelligence community had signed off on" when she spoke — and therefore does not deserve the criticism she's gotten from some Republicans. RETHUGS: GET OVER IT AND GET ON WITH THE NATIONS BUSINESS!!!

Message.Title: When they finally release Android for desktop, Microsoft is finished.
Message.Msg: Win 8 = fail. Gonna take down a chunk of the whole PC market with it. Brother in law says he won't buy a new PC now because they all come with Win 8. He's waiting for them to revert to Win 7. Huge, historic mistake by Microsoft, betting the farm on 8. This company is just outta gas. The mismanagement is hard to believe. One of these months, Google will release Android for desktop. The first 3 or 4 revs will suck, then they'll get it half-right, then 3/4 right, then stable and then super-cool. And that will be the end of Microsoft. They can go make X-boxes or something.
